data.title: La French Tech community label launched in the Philippines
data.meta_description: The Embassy of France is pleased to announce the launch of the French Tech community label in the Philippines. We congratulate the Philippine-based French entrepreneurs in the innovation sector whose commitment was invaluable to this success. The establishment of a French Tech community in the Philippines launches a new phase in the development of this dynamic community that contributes to the image of an enterprising France that stands out internationally.
data.meta_site_name: La France aux Philippines et en Micronésie
data.text:
The Embassy of France is pleased to announce the launch of the French Tech community label in the Philippines.

We congratulate the Philippine-based French entrepreneurs in the innovation sector whose commitment was invaluable to this success. The establishment of a French Tech community in the Philippines launches a new phase in the development of this dynamic community that contributes to the image of an enterprising France that stands out internationally.

The members of the board of La French Tech Philippines are the following:

Tristan de Belloy, President

Frédéric Levy, in-charge of start-ups

Delphine Vermont, in-charge of sponsorships and communications support

Guillaume Regnier, in-charge of communications

Nicolas Suchaut, in-charge of events

La French Tech is the French start-up movement. Its mission is to make France an attractive place for start-ups seeking to conquer international markets. Through its network of Philippine-based French entrepreneurs in the tech sector, and with the support of the French Embassy, the French Tech Philippines community will be able to contribute locally to this objective.

The French Tech network is made up of various locally-based French Tech communities in France and abroad. These communities are hubs that bring together start-up founders, investors, collaborators, and other actors comprising the tech ecosystem. Today, the French innovation ecosystem is booming with 10,000 start-ups, six unicorns, more than 300 incubators, 50 accelerators, renowned research institutions (such as the French National Center for Scientific Research, the French Institute for Research in Computer Science and Automation, and the French National Center for Space Studies, among others), and 71 innovation clusters and centers of technological excellence.

The international network shares the vision of the French Tech’s public action and is committed to mobilizing its local communities to achieve its objectives.

Learn more about La French Tech : https://lafrenchtech.com/fr/

Discover the French Tech Visa - a simplified procedure for foreign talents to obtain the “Talent Passport” as a multi-year residence permit : https://lafrenchtech.com/en/how-france-helps-startups/french-tech-visa/

Follow the activities of La French Tech Philippines online:

https://frenchtech-ph.com/

https://www.facebook.com/frenchtechphils/

If you wish to join La French Tech Philippines, send them an email at hello@frenchtech-ph.com.
